availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John G. Jordan (Anderson County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Anderson County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Jane H. Jordan. Father of Thomas Jordan, George W. Jordan, William A. Jordan, Elizabeth Jordan, Octavia Jordan, Calpernia Jordan, Edmund Jordan, and Lorell Jordan. Farmer with Thomas Jordan and George W. Jordan in Anderson County in 1850. Owned eight enslaved persons in Anderson County in 1850. Farmer with Edmund Jordan in Anderson County in 1860. Owned ten enslaved persons in Anderson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County, p. 209B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County, p. 18.
